Trims predicted values based on min and max values provided. Useful where you want to ensure that predicted values are limited at the range of observed values.

Source: R/trim-pred-data.R
dh.trimPredData.Rd

Trims predicted values based on min and max values provided. Useful where you want to ensure that predicted values are limited at the range of observed values.

dh.trimPredData(
  pred = NULL,
  coh_names = NULL,
  age = "age",
  min = NULL,
  max = NULL
)

Arguments

pred

a tibble of predicted values
coh_names

a vector of cohort names corresponding to the cohort names in pred
age

name of the variable corresponding to age in the predicted values
min

a vector of minimum values of age, length equal to number of cohorts
max

a vector of maximum values of age, length equal to number of cohorts

Value

The original tibble of predicted values, trimmed by the min and max ages

Contents
